channel.title: Videos crash browsers, no sound on VLC
channel.description:
Long story short: as of this morning, whenever I try to watch a video on any browser (IE, Firefox, Chrome), the browser crashes. Furthermore, when I try to open my video files with VLC (movies, tv shows etc. which I've watched many times before), the video shows perfectly but there's no sound at all. What puzzles me is that I'm able to listen to music on Spotify and iTunes to mention a few.
I reinstalled all Adobe products, including flash, shockwave, reader and air. Nothing helped, browser still keeps crashing.
Additional information:
I haven't installed any new programs lately. I ran Spybot S&D which found and deleted some malware, nothing too serious. Firefox and Chrome are latest versions, IE is 8.
I also tried the new HTML5 feature on youtube and managed, momentarily, to get the videos working (though they are laggy and terrible) but once again, there's no sound.
Windows 7, laptop, HP.
What can I do? :confused::confused::confused::confused::confused::confused::confused::confused::confused::confused: I'd rather not format, since there's a crapton of stuff on the laptop which would take ages to backup.
EDIT: Everything was fine yesterday.
